title: Linux w Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the w command in Linux, learn how to analyze user login sessions, and monitor system load and resource utilization for effective system management.

meta.title: Linux w Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the w command in Linux, learn how to analyze user login sessions, and monitor system load and resource utilization for effective system management.
meta.keywords: Linux, w command, system monitoring, user sessions, system load, resource utilization

verify.name: Verify the w command output
verify.hint: The output of the `w` command should contain the header line with the column names.

verify.name: Verify the w command output
verify.hint: The output of the `w` command should contain the user `user2`.

verify.name: Verify the who command output
verify.hint: The output of the `who` command should contain the user `user2`.

steps.title: Monitor System Load and Resource Utilization

verify.name: Verify the w command output
verify.hint: The output of the `w` command should contain the system load average information.

verify.name: Verify the top command output
verify.hint: The output of the `top` command should contain the CPU utilization information.

verify.name: Verify the free command output
verify.hint: The output of the `free` command should contain the memory utilization information.
